Raj Darbar is a restaurant located at Via Domenico Turazza, 27, 35128. 
It has an average rating of 3.8 over 5 based on 122 costumers.
It is considered moderate ($$). This restaurant offers delivery, dine-in, and reservation services. It serves lunch, dinner, and beer. 

Schedule is not available. 

Phone: 338 721 4122

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-22): "I had the opportunity to dine at the Raj Darbar restaurant for our group of 86 guests in the end of October, and I can confidently assure you that no other restaurant can match the quality of the catering to Indian cuisine. Mr. Alok Seghal, the proprietor of this restaurant, is a gentleman who combines taste and personal service. He is one of the most approachable gentlemen I have encountered in a long time. He was exceptionally flexible with our group's schedule, and also, when some of our guests had specific requests, he was willing to accommodate them. The Raj Darbar is over 18 years old and can comfortably accommodate a capacity of 100 individuals at a time. It is strategically situated in Padua, Italy, a mere 30 minutes from the picturesque city of Venice. Every meal served here is a celebration of authentic Indian flavours, and as previously mentioned, unparalleled hospitality. The cuisine, ranging from Jain to vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes, coupled with its warm ambience, was a pleasure to dine in. Given my second visit to this establishment, I feel the cuisine served gives you a typical home-cooked meal feel, and that resonates with guests. The entire team of Mr Alok interacts with the guests and creates a comfortable atmosphere. They do not rush you to get done eating. Instead, they allow guests to relax and enjoy the meal. In some establishments, even before the meal is completed, they serve the dessert onto the table, indicating its time for the meal to be finished, wrap up, and leave. Should you be in Padua and have the opportunity to visit Venice, kindly consider making a stopover and be treated with the utmost respect. It feels like a Raja ka Darbar experience. Raj Darbar Restaurant Via Domenico Turazza, 27, 35128 Padova PD, Italy Warm regards, Alan Woods"
    - (1 stars, 2025-06-27): "Lady owner hospitality is zero. She thinks she rules the world. Food below average. Ask people to remove dishes after food is finish."
    - (3 stars, 2023-05-01): "Nice behavior of staff with nice place. Foods was very good. It‚Äôs very much testy for Asian, specially Bangladeshi, Indian and Pakistani. Nice environment."
    - (5 stars, 2024-09-19): "This restaurant truly goes above and beyond, and We are so grateful for their honesty and exceptional service! After enjoying a fantastic meal, one of my group members accidentally left a bag behind, filled with two iPhones and a lot of cash . We didn't even realize it was missing until we had already left. To our absolute relief, the restaurant staff called me to inform me they had found it. Above that, they even drove to our place to return the belongings! We can't express how thankful we are for their honesty and quick action. On top of their fantastic customer service, the meal was top-notch‚Äîevery dish was flavorful, fresh, and beautifully presented. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, making the whole dining experience enjoyable. Highly recommend this place for great Indian food and exceptional service. They truly care about their customers!"
    - (4 stars, 2019-11-18): "Enjoyed delicious Indian food here Daal was very tasty Overall atmosphere was serene"

    - (3 stars, 2025-06-04): "Sunday, June 1st. We had two granitas and two brioche with a lemon tuppoüçß that still had to be ‚Äúrestored‚Äù so we opted for mulberries and almonds. The mulberries were good, maybe a little too much sugar for my taste, the almond was decent, but for Padua it‚Äôs an excellent granita. Let‚Äôs get to the sore point: ALMOST ‚Ç¨12 FOR TWO GRANITAS IS ON THE LIMIT OF ARMED ROBBERY, especially since there is no service and therefore this crazy price has no way of existing. Thanks, well done but never again. Fruit, water and sugar. ‚Ç¨4 plus the price of the brioche ‚Ç¨1.80 (another robbery) is intolerable."
    - (4 stars, 2025-03-08): "Excellent snack. I took a gluten-free cannoli which was filled on the spot, very fresh and good cream. I also got an arancini which was heated carefully for contamination. My friend (non-celiac) was also pleasantly satisfied. I spent ‚Ç¨9."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-27): "The bomba are so good we returned twice. Be ready to need to go and wash your face there is so much filling. Great breakfast deal means coffee is free with the Pastry."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-28): "We wanted to try this new place, driven by the curiosity of a reel. We were pampered the whole time, each dish was carefully explained to us to make us understand how everything is meticulously prepared. The quality is high, the portions are just right. We had some chips left and when we asked for the doggy bag they gave us a free sauce! We also ordered two take-away desserts for breakfast and at the end they offered us two shots of ice cream. What can I say, excellent place, worth it."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-24): "Very nice place very close to Piazzale Stanga. Staff really very kind and helpful. We ate the excellent "la bomba" sandwich accompanied by amazing chips and finished with the sweet cream bomb, exceptional. An experience that we will definitely repeat, I recommend taking a look."
    - (4 stars, 2025-06-30): "After arriving in the lovely Padova and finding out that they stole my bike, and you have to take a very hot bus to get to work, hungry and with nothing open, this was an oasis in the desert. Fresh air, mega clean bathrooms, great service, quiet and empty for the time I suppose. For breakfast, I had a cappuccino, a very good empty bomb and an apricot brioche that only had a teaspoon of jam üòÖ and was a little dry, but well it saved me from fainting jajaja. I will return for emergencies because I really thought it was more hip√© than good meal."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-28): "For the first time in this wonderful place, I will definitely return. Everything new and fragrant, with a great variety of delicacies and the staff very courteous and kind."

Phone: 375 666 0432

Reviews:
    - (1 stars, 2024-12-29): "Terrible Food and Awful Customer Service: This cafe in Padova was an absolute disappointment. We had a terrible experience there. The staff were RUDE and the place felt UNFRIENDLY. They served us BURNED FOOD, and when we pointed it out, they responded disrespectfully. On top of that, they charge ‚Ç¨3 per person for service, which was far from acceptable The meats and all three dishes we tried were nothing close to authentic Lebanese cuisine‚Äîeverything was extremely dry and poorly prepared. Would not recommend!"
    - (5 stars, 2022-12-02): "Am so glad we decided to drive 40 minutes to try this restaurant! The food was authentic Lebanese, delicious and fresh. The service was great and the staff are very nice. Service is also fast but not rushing and they make sure they bring you the dishes in stages so that they don't get cold. We tried must of the appetizers and they were all delicious. We also tried the shawerma and the mixed grill which both were great too. Everything about dinner in this restaurant was great and the waiter was happy to share his recommendations with us and they were all great. I highly recommend this restaurant for a change from the typical Italian cusine to something different."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-31): "I was at Habibi's restaurant last night with a friend, and the experience was very positive. The atmosphere was great and the food was awesome. The restaurant is quite and clean, and the waiter was super helpful and kind. I would definitely recommend it and I'll be back ti try more."
    - (5 stars, 2022-08-31): "Beautiful small restaurant - a little bit hidden in the industrial zone. We've been there an had fattoush salad, kafta sandwich an taouk plate. Everything was very good, well spiced and freshly made. Service was friendly and prices fair."
    - (1 stars, 2024-12-29): "Tried this place with family, but unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience. I understand food can vary from place to place, and that‚Äôs fine. However, the waiter‚Äôs poor behavior was completely unacceptable. We were served burned food, and when we politely pointed it out and asked for it to be taken back since it was inedible and tasted very bitter, we expected a simple apology and resolution. Instead, the waiter argued, insisting the food wasn‚Äôt burned, and his tone and choice of words were extremely rude. To avoid further conflict, we decided not to continue the conversation. Unfortunately, during checkout, the same waiter‚Äôs attitude worsened, escalating the situation further. Thankfully, someone from the back eventually came forward (probably he is the owner or someone from management) and apologized for the behavior. We appreciate his professionalism and positive approach. I hope the owner takes this feedback constructively and focuses on training their team to provide better customer service."

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2023-03-11): "Nothing special but you can find what you are looking for right there! I would go again"
    - (4 stars, 2021-10-05): "Small but welcoming bar, equipped with a large seating area with tables, where it is possible to enjoy good breakfasts, excellent aperitifs, but also take a lunch break with daily menus always carefully prepared. You can find arancini and other Sicilian street food dishes, or taste the Gufo spritz, a house specialty prepared with the Sicilian amaro of Giancasciu. Open every day except Sunday."
    - (5 stars, 2023-01-24): "And after the delicious pizzas made with three re-milled flours I wanted to try the arancino with homemade rag√π and fried in Sicilian olive oil. An obligatory stop for an aperitif in Padua or for a typical dinner."
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-03): "Great place for a quick lunch break snack. The slice of pizza I tried was very good and well-filled, as well as heated on the spot. A menu of quick first courses is also available. The guys who served me were very kind and helpful. I will definitely go back if I find myself in the area!"
    - (5 stars, 2022-09-09): "It's a shame we can't give 15 stars. The legendary bartender, who always welcomes her customers with a smile. Dedicated cocktail for friends of Sicily. Absolutely worth trying: "DANIELE'S APERITIF""

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-23): "Meat coma! After you order your side dishes they send you out you to the grill side meat station to pick out your cuts and actually pieces of meat. They recommend groups pick several different cuts and they are served family style. We had 3 cuts, filet, strip and flank steak. The steak is weighed and you pay based on the weight. The steaks are seasoned and cooked perfectly. The restaurant is tucked away in the back corner of a residential area not far from the city wall near SR47 and has free parking if you have a car. The restaurant filled up quickly so I suggest making reservations. We were stuffed and couldn't fit dessert but they said that they were made in house and they looked good."
    - (4 stars, 2024-09-01): "The best: meat menu. They have a small menu for antipasto and side dishes BUT the while thing is the meat. They will ask you to stand up and go to the grill with the cooker in order to choose the type of meat and the cooking intensity. They will offer a little antipasto with bread, a special spread and meat balls. Service was gentile but a bit slow because of the way they do the meat. Food was delicious and good portions. They also have house wine at a good price. I would consider this place for a date. At the end they offer us a small shot of liquirizia. They have a small parking area outside the osteria. I would recommend to book before if you are in a big group."
    - (5 stars, 2023-06-27): "Today me and my familly wisit this perfect restaurant. Personal was amaizing friendlly. Food actualy its really bomba. Vine its excelent for meet. Really best choise in paduja. Recomending for everybody."
    - (5 stars, 2019-09-19): "Delicious and great service."
    - (5 stars, 2020-02-09): "Excellent grilled meat, ludicrous variety of cuts. House wine recommended."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-07-05): "Suggestive environment that offers the perfect balance between good food, good drinks and location. Whether you want to be with family and friends, whether you are a sportsman or just a pleasure-seeker, it is the right place to spend a pleasant evening! To return!!!!"
    - (5 stars, 2023-11-13): "Excellent dinner, very quiet and well-kept environment. Very helpful and welcoming staff. Fair price, aperitif with cicchetti offered, two courses each (appetizer, first course and two second courses), bottle of Lugano and dessert we spent about 50 euros each, leaving full and very satisfied from this bistro. Highly recommended!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-12): "I recently organized a corporate aperitif/dinner at the Wimbledon in Padua and the experience was fantastic. The menu starts from 15 euros per person, with the possibility of adding options such as a delicious platter of cold cuts. The food was plentiful and the drinks perfect. The outdoor atmosphere was made magical by the choreography with the strings of lights and by the talented Laura Pirri, who enchanted everyone with her voice interpreting a beautiful repertoire of Dalla and Battisti accompanied by the Movietrio band. The children also had a lot of fun playing the games in the park. Highly recommended for unforgettable events and evenings!"
    - (4 stars, 2024-12-24): "It's a place in the tennis club. Elegant enough. I was there for a live evening of great music. The menu offers dishes for a full dinner but also for something less demanding. Good quality of dishes."
    - (5 stars, 2024-12-27): "Very convivial environment and perfect for a social dinner like ours, we ate well both meat and vegetable menus and had fun thanks to the space we had to dance. An environment to keep in mind for an upcoming dinner with friends..."

Phone: 049 871 0924

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2024-10-27): "A restaurant that has the charm of a local trattoria. The owner is very welcoming; he greeted us with great respect and recommended dishes based on our preferences. I was there with friends, and he suggested we order the 'Friendship Plate' so we could try a variety of dishes. We ate very well, definitely a place to recommend."
    - (5 stars, 2024-01-06): "I would wholeheartedly recommend Ristorante Dahlak. I felt like going to my grandma's place - the atmosphere was cosy and the food was magnificient. It was my first time eating Eritrean food and would definitely love to eat it again. The last, but not the least - the owner makes you feel as if you were in your home: he explained us each dish and suggested what might be the best. I am looking forward to coming to Dahlak again when I visit Padova. üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª for Dahlak!"
    - (5 stars, 2022-01-23): "We arrived at 8 and COVID passes checked and sat down with ease , we were given water and drinks almost immediately while we were choosing from the menu and then the owner came over, explained everything to the table and we were right to trust his instincts, he recommended that we choose a selection of meat and vegetarian dishes and the 4 of us shared everything in the middle of the table and we ate with our hands ripping pieces of the typical bread it's served with and scooping up what we wanted, he said that they also had zebra and antelope so we tried that too ! Great suggestion. Overall 4 very happy and (full) people, the usual cover charge and drinks ,water, 1 and a 1/2 L of red wine. Came to ‚Ç¨90. Great value for money and I would recommend to others if they want something completely different."
    - (2 stars, 2024-01-14): "I wouldn't recommend anyone specifically with an experience of visiting habeshan restaurants. First of all, as a habeshan native, the "shiro" was undercooked and tasteless. The chicken was a bare bone with no habeshan taste. The so-called Buffalo stew was a little bit better than any of the foods served. Since the "injera" is made from wheat flour rather than the original teff grain, it's not gluten-free advertisement is a joke. Plus, price,‚Ç¨20, it's not worth it at all."
    - (5 stars, 2022-12-24): "Whenever I come back to Padua, I try to get the time for a dinner here. The food is delicious and the owner is very friendly. It geniunely feels like dining at a friend's house! Can't recommend it more."

I was particularly impressed by the gnocchi with sheep rag√π. The deserts were also excellent. Overall a great experience and I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town."
    - (5 stars, 2023-12-04): "An intimate and welcoming place, well furnished with art paintings, but above all you will find passionate cuisine with local products of the highest quality. Cold cuts and polenta that feel like home, as well as the well-matched homemade pasta. Selected wines for all budgets. Very honest prices especially if you compare the quality of the products. Very friendly and attentive staff. Highly recommended for a quick lunch but also for a rich dinner with friends who want good, healthy things."
    - (5 stars, 2024-10-09): "The restaurant par excellence for "doing a shoe"! the perfect combination of tradition and modernity, simple but accurate recipes, a small and welcoming place! the strong point is the quality of the raw materials and the cellar, full of local goodies ..ah, and all just a stone's throw from the center and at very honest prices!"
    - (3 stars, 2025-02-02): "Unfortunately it wasn't a good experience. I went in December with some friends, booking in advance, to celebrate my birthday There were 10 of us and they put us on the veranda, heated by mushrooms but the cold came from underneath because the floor is not fixed. We were very cold and one of the guests was ill during the night. One of the main dishes is the tartare arias but we were unable to order them because they were sold out It should be noted that I booked 3 weeks in advance However, what we ate was good as was the service"
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-25): "Everything was delicious and the staff were helpful and friendly. Highly recommended! ‚úåÔ∏è"

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2016-03-11): "Good pizza to go, I had salsiccia e radicchio and loved it!"
    - (5 stars, 2023-05-01): "2 pizzas both very crunchy and delicious."
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-28): "Great pizza! No eating on site possible! But very, very tasty pizza! Price great! Ready in 10 minutes!"
    - (5 stars, 2023-01-02): "Discovered somewhat by chance, I can say it was a decidedly positive discovery. Ordered via justEat, the delivery time was "a little ahead" - when I contacted the pizzeria they suggested I come and pick them up to have them at the time I was interested in. Pizzas ready at the time agreed upon by telephone. Already from the box, the perfume promised very well; upon opening and tasting I had confirmation. Tasty ingredients on a soft and tasty base. Cooking "correctly" and not hastily, the ingredients were all well integrated into the base. Some small "black" marks on the pizzas but without any consequences on the taste or consistency of the dough. Added to the list of favorite pizzerias in the area."
    - (1 stars, 2025-01-16): "The pizza is decent, definitely worse than it used to be. I have been a customer since 2020, or rather I was until a couple of weeks ago when, having a friend who is stopping by for dinner, to avoid the risk of receiving cold pizzas like it happens with any delivery, I opted for the "shop near my house" (200 meters away). At 6.40 pm, well in advance, I ordered 3 pizzas with delivery no earlier than 8.30 pm. I was told "8.30 pm/8.40 pm". Perfect.... The pizzas arrived at 8.52 pm COLD!! Everyone can make a mistake but if you tell me that the guy had another delivery before mine, being 200 meters away from my house, then no! Padua is full of pizzerias and if you don't understand that the competitive advantage of the shop compared to a delivery is precisely that of customer care, then you have understood nothing ... No gesture, I don't know, as a customer I would have expected "I'll give you a pizza for the next order" .... but imagine .... and what's more the response was even arrogant! Ps: even Deliveroo apologizes and refunds you part of the order!"

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2024-11-23): "Yesterday I had the pleasure of dining at this charming pizzeria, and it was a delightful experience. The atmosphere is a perfect blend of rustic and modern, with exposed walls that add character and a minimalist design that feels cozy yet contemporary. The soft lighting and touches of greenery create a welcoming ambiance. The pizza was exceptional! The crust was perfectly baked‚Äîlight and airy with just the right amount of crispiness. The toppings, especially the spicy salami, were of excellent quality, bursting with flavor and paired beautifully with the melted mozzarella. It was evident that fresh ingredients were used. Service was friendly and efficient, contributing to the relaxed vibe of the place. The attention to detail, from the table settings to the decor, made the experience even more enjoyable. If you‚Äôre looking for a stylish yet unpretentious spot for great pizza, this pizzeria is a must-visit. Highly recommended!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-19): "Great Neapolitan pizza, easily digestible. The place is modern and full of plants which gives it a cool vibe. The beer is also very good! As soon as you get in, you can see the professional pizza oven on the right. Would go back and recommend too!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-12-14): "Extremely delicious pizza, one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. I went there about 5 times now and it‚Äôs a pleasure every time. The service is great, very friendly waiters and it‚Äôs pretty cozy. But the pizza is the star of the show. You can really taste that they use very good quality ingredients. Honesty incredible and a place you should definitely check out! Prices are also very fair, it‚Äôs a bit more expensive than many other pizzerias but it‚Äôs also just better."
    - (5 stars, 2022-09-08): "One of the best pizza in Padova, the atmosphere is very modern and nice and the pizza is napoli style (so if you don't like the high pizza it's not the place for you). Also the desserts are very original and tasty"
    - (4 stars, 2024-12-08): "Refined pizzeria and restaurant in the central area of ‚Äã‚ÄãPadua, with a "vintage" setting. The staff is friendly and you can appreciate refined specialties with genuine flavors combined in original combinations, obtained with fresh and quality ingredients. It is certainly worth a visit."

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2025-05-23): "I'm not an experience guy, I mean, when I go to a restaurant, I want to eat, not having an experience. This case is different. The owner, that is the bartender too, seems to have an infinite knowledge about cocktails, suggesting the best according to client taste or wish. Eating was wonderful, pasta tasted great and the filet came from another world. Never eaten such a meat, extremely tender and tasty. Wine was very good and dessert gorgeous. Waiters extremely polite and professional, location really nice, it makes you feel like you are in Great Gatsby NY. Final price is fair for the knowledge of the owner, the cure of dishes preparation and quality of raw materials. Few tables, reservation is strongly suggested"
    - (5 stars, 2025-03-04): "I love this place! They have plenty options of drinks and cocktails. The ambience is also very cozy with a dash of preppy atmosphere. I tried vodka based cocktail and it was amazing! Not to forget about the lady that served us and the gentleman behind the bar that were very sweet and helpful to us. They have spacious parking on the front and I think this place is very good to have nice drinks during late spring or summer because they have a spacious and neat terrace. Definitely will be back when I visit Padova in the future. Good job guys ‚ù§Ô∏è"
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-01): "This place is absolutely amazing! I highly recommended this place for a night time vibe. Great for date night or a gathering friends. The cocktails are great. The staff is so friendly and welcoming. They took very great care of my friends and I with their recommendations and attention to our drinks. I will definitely be back."
    - (2 stars, 2024-11-16): "Lovely and sophisticated inside. But the cocktails were very bland. The Bloody Mary was like a glass of passata tomatoe sauce. The service could be friendlier."
    - (5 stars, 2023-03-28): "Beautiful and delicious cocktails and amazing service!!"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-03-15): "Good food in a nice atmosphere, super friendly staff and a cozy place. Was there with some friends, we were able to have a nice chat with the lady that owns the restaurant, getting to know a bit more about her country and traditions. Place is not small, but able to give the family owned business that you may expect in a restaurant like that. They offered the first round of drinks, not bad. Overall a good experience, you should give it a try."
    - (5 stars, 2024-09-24): "It is a Greek restaurant run by a very friendly Greek couple. They don‚Äôt speak much English but Google translate came to rescue. The food was delicious. Another reviewer said that the food was not fresh for him. I am sure the owners would change the food or remedy it in some way if you talk to them. It is a cosy place located in a rather unpopular place so it would require attention to find. Because of this I gave 4 stars for atmosphere."
    - (5 stars, 2022-07-05): "I and my partner who happens to be Greek love this place this is the only review I have written but we have been many times over the years, the service is always great and the menu does change based on the availability of products which I see as a positive thing because everything is fresh and seasonal. I highly recommend getting a bunch of dishes for the centre of the table and everyone helping themselves to a little bit of each dish with sauces on the side and side dishes instead of individual meals. In order to really taste what they have to offer."
    - (2 stars, 2024-03-23): "While the service and the atmosphere are nice, the food is definitely was the weakest part. it‚Äôs not the authenticity of the food, it‚Äôs the freshness and quality of the ingredients. the owner and servers are way too nice, making it harder to leave a bad review."
    - (5 stars, 2019-03-04): "Costas the friendly manager met us at the door with great hospitality and was very welcoming. It was quiet inside but nice traditional decorations. We felt at home and the food was excellent. The tzatziki was particularly nice and we enjoyed the meatballs and gyros. We really enjoyed our time here and look forward to returning to try the rest of the menu."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-16): "We had an amazing evening at Piave, the view from terrace is amazing, the old church and small bridge. The couple who runs the restaurant was very attentive to our needs, the service was amazing, the food was fantastic! We highly recommend herbs gnocchi and breated beef with merlot and soft polenta. The meat was super soft and delicious! Thank you so much!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-09): "We came here following all the positive reviews and weren't disappointed. Very good restaurant with reasonable prices and delicious local cuisine. They had menu in English and the waitress had enough English to communicate with us. Overall we had a great experience in this cosy and friendly hostaria."
    - (5 stars, 2025-03-24): "I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. We probably tried almost all of their starters and they were all delicious. The pappardelle was super tasty and so was the Panna cotta. The service is excellent and The atmosphere is perfect for a date night or a chilled dinner with friends. Prices are reasonable and the quality of the food is great!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-15): "A perfect night, and some of the best octopus, tartare, and eggplant I've ever had. Gorgeous plating. Creative use of beautiful ingredients, and excellent service. Seems like poor reviews are people complaining of "small portions", which is ridiculous to me, as we were fit to burst by the end of the meal. Worst case, the prices are so reasonable, just get an extra dish. ;)"
    - (4 stars, 2022-08-19): "Cute restaurant with a vibrantly decorated interior full of color, friendly service and competitive prices. Whilst small, their menu offers a good variety of choices. Each dish we tried was delicious and made with high quality ingredients. The baby cuttlefish cooked in squid ink served with creamy polenta were tender and tasty. Their tiramisu was to die for, so creamy, smooth and decadent, whilst their lemon sorbet with licorice liquor was refreshing and zingy."

Good potato croquettes too. Recommended. I was surprised to read some of the negative reviews but realised this has to do with deliveries - this is good pizza, and it‚Äôs best eaten hot.     - (5 stars, 2025-05-28): "I had a lovely dinner there on a Tuesday night. The owner told me the pasta would take a while to cook and offered me two bruschetta on the house as I waited. The pasta was good (and hot.) I also had a really good dessert. Total cost with a quarter liter of wine was under 20 euros so it is also a great value."
    - (4 stars, 2025-02-15): "A corner of good dining in Padua, managed with great professionalism and competence by the owners, who boast a working history in the most important restaurants in the city of Padua and beyond. The hand of the chef is perceived in the originality and sobriety with which the dishes are prepared which never betray expectations. The local Bottega di Gi√≤ is a pleasant place where you can find good food but above all family warmth. Reservations are recommended, as the place is almost always fully booked. Parking in the immediate vicinity and easy to reach."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-16): "Comfortable environment, kind and sunny staff. Excellent food, dishes prepared with professionalism and imagination with products chosen from the best quality. Compliments to the chef and to all of you. Thank you"
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-15): "I recommend this little restaurant in the Palestro area for the quality of the food, the courtesy of the service and the quality-price ratio that is unrivaled in the city. I will definitely be back!!!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-01-08): "Really nice place and so are the staff. The food is really good and the service is fast even for those who have little time to eat! The spritzes are also excellent, ideal for aperitifs. They also do takeaway service"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2024-05-16): "Super"
    - (5 stars, 2023-10-27): "We stopped for a quick dinner! They have a table with 4 stools! Menu with wide choice! We had a hamburger and a club sandwich. Quality products that make everything delicious, plus the extreme kindness and courtesy of the staff to satisfy our requests!!! We thank you"
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-23): "We usually order burgers, excellent! Burgers and fries are plentiful. Staff always nice and helpful. We have ordered both take-out and home delivery and we have always been happy. This evening I tried their special pizza, very special with lots of spices, sausage, dried tomatoes and crispy onion. For some it may seem "challenging" but in reality it is light, the rosemary flavor prevails, the other ingredients are very balanced between them and among all the spices the curry prevails. I will gladly take it again and I recommend it to all the curious!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-04-27): "Since they opened we always get pizza strictly with the ceramic plate (it really makes a difference) I always get gluten-free pizza and I have to say the best in Padua. Last evening we tried the burgers (with gluten-free bread)... excellent!!! Truly first choice meat (100% Italian Chianina), excellent cooking and perfect combinations. A decidedly rich and varied menu. You can see that they have passion and put maximum effort into it. Delivery that splits the minute. The dishes are really good, the owners and all the staff are great!!! Vote 10!!!!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-09): "Excellent pizza! Home service with a hot ceramic plate really makes the difference: the pizza remains hot and crunchy as if it had just been served in a pizzeria."

Spunciotti Di Pesce - Andreazzi Nereo is a restaurant located at Piazzale Porta S. Giovanni, 35141. 
It has an average rating of 4.1 over 5 based on 15 costumers.
Unfortunately, price is not available. This restaurant offers dine-in, and reservation services. It serves lunch, dinner, beer, and wine.

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2023-05-30): "Fresh fish spunciotti. A historic place in Padua for street food. You won't find the classic sea bass, but more particular fish such as mussels, octopus, fish rag√π, shrimp, fried fish (which is delicious), sardines, and cod (also delicious) and much more. Those who say they didn't like it could go to a fish restaurant, street food is something else. Suitable for adults given the type of tastes, except for children and young people who like, for example, the dishes listed above."
    - (5 stars, 2023-12-28): "if you want a quality product this is the right place, it's a place to get takeaway fish... the best creamed cod I've ever tasted, you can also find Vicenza-style cod, boiled fish and fried fish... I highly recommend it. prices in line with the product."
    - (5 stars, 2023-09-16): "Folpi like "na volta" at this kiosk which opens its doors towards the evening and is a well-known destination for DOC Paduans. Decentralized but appreciated fish site, it offers the classic traditional boiled Folpetti together with some absolutely enjoyable snacks (prawns, cuttlefish eggs, mussels...). The manager is friendly and the prices are appropriate for the dishes which must necessarily be accompanied by a good glass of white wine. It is not a gourmet dinner, but a pleasant and tasty aperitif that can be eaten standing up, together with a chat for half an hour of relaxation."

    - (5 stars, 2023-12-21): "I have had the pleasure of being served my Laura. She was the absolute amazing when it come to quality service. She was able to assist me and my friend with the drink selection and made sure that we wanted what we wanted. She did not make us feel rushed at all. Ensure that we had space to feel comfortable and welcome. Took her time translating the dessert menu for us as well and even called us a taxi at the end of the meal. The food was amazing. Laura went into depth about the menu and what this place has to offer and as someone that is coming from the USA. I high recommend this place if you are visiting Padova, Italy. Ask for Laura."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-30): "Incredible quality of service and a delightful menu, the wine list is extensive and they are very accommodating to English speakers. A very elegant and delightful place to have dinner."

Phone: 049 490 7619

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-24): "I had dinner there on Thursday night before going home. Very nice place that I discovered has been open for a very short time; the owner is a very kind guy who welcomed us warmly and briefly explained what they do. My girlfriend and I thought about taking a couple of slices each, but I ended up taking 4 just me because I wanted to taste as much as possible: fragrant dough, cooked to perfection and tasty ingredients. My girlfriend took another slice of pizza with pesto after finishing the first because it was delicious. Highly recommended place for take away but that also leaves satisfied those like us who stopped to eat on site thanks to the shelf and chairs that allow you to consume the food. The service is spartan but understandable: it is an extra service that a take-away bakery offers, we went on the third day since the opening of the place (so I learned from the chat with the owner) and it is compensated by the warmth and care that they let transpire. My girlfriend also took a cookie that she appreciated. The place also sells bread and some sweets but I didn't have the chance to try them. I took home a couple of focaccias, one with potatoes (pictured) and they are also very good. In a couple of days I can say that the doughs have risen more than enough because I have never been thirsty despite having eaten abundantly accompanied only with a beer. Highly recommended place if you have the chance to pass by or have parked like us near the valley meadow."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-29): "Very well-kept place a stone's throw from Prato della Valle with the possibility of eating inside. Really good pizzas and focaccias, prepared with top-quality ingredients. The desserts are also good. I've been there several times and I've tasted a delicious apple pie and some excellent Venetian biscuits made by Leo's Bakery. Always welcomed and served with a smile. I'll definitely be back!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-26): "Very good pizzas and focaccias, with an excellent dough and quality ingredients. Very digestible. New, tidy and very clean environment, kind and friendly service! A few steps from Prato della Valle!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-25): "Excellent dough, super light and digestible, all seasoned with quality ingredients! Leonardo, the owner, young and very kind in his welcome and explanations. You can see the passion for this job, all to be appreciated in such a young guy. Highly recommended both for eating on the spot and for a quick take away. If I pass through Padua, I will definitely stop by Leo's Bakery again!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-10): "Amazing! Delicious dough, top quality ingredients‚Ä¶ excellent service and super kindness! I recommend it to everyone‚Ä¶ we need more places like this in Padua! It makes the difference!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-24): "This was the best dinner of our entire trip‚Äîwe loved everything! The hospitality of the owner and the waiter was exceptional. The food was amazing, especially the octopus carpaccio and the proccheri with gorgonzola and pear. The restaurant features a fantastic pianist with incredible charm, making the evening even more special. Thank you so much for a wonderful night! It's a shame we have to leave. If we were staying longer, we would definitely come back."
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-08): "We had beef Wellington and it was juicy and delicious and we enjoyed a piano performance and the star of the show was a little dog and it was really cute ."
    - (4 stars, 2024-10-26): "Recently, we had the pleasure of dining at Ristorante Caff√® Letterario Treccani in Padova. While the ambiance was lively, it did lean a bit too noisy at times due to the jazz band. However, the food more than made up for the acoustics. The Bigoli in salsa Veneto was a delightful start‚Äîrich and flavorful. The beef fillet wellington that followed was extra yummy, cooked to perfection and bursting with taste. To top it all off, the pistachio tiramis√π was quite an interesting twist on a classic dessert, leaving a memorable impression. Despite the noise, the culinary experience at Ristorante Caff√® Letterario Treccani was well worth it, and the delicious food left us more than satisfied."
    - (5 stars, 2023-12-31): "Delicious delicious delicious! Highly recommend the 3 dishes shown. We took a chance on the tiramisu as it was something new to us and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The sweetness of the tiramisu and the cherry liquor was very well balanced."
    - (5 stars, 2023-08-20): "Delicious!! Good price, very fast and nice. We were looking for a place to sit all over town and couldn‚Äôt find any restaurant open. The chef was there and was so kind to cook for us out of the restaurant times."

There are also other mini pizza variations at different prices, so there's something for everyone. The owner is also very friendly and polite. I can highly recommend it to everyone. Top Top Top!"

    - (2 stars, 2025-04-15): "The pizza is good and is available in many flavors, the staff is friendly and the environment is clean. However, although the option for celiacs is available on the menu, this option is actually non-existent. After we were asked to request pizza for celiacs one day before picking up, our request was never granted. Four times we went in person to request it and four times we were given different excuses: from the simple "sorry, it's not available" to "from next week". If gluten-free pizza is not available it must be removed from the menu. And, in any case, it is not right to guarantee that he is present and then summarize the next day."
    - (1 stars, 2025-04-15): "Very bad experience. Although the online and physical menu shows the gluten-free variant, once we were told to order the dough in advance, 3 other times despite the order the product was never present."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-16): "The person who works there is very friendly. He let me taste several options before making a purchase. Good value for money. The pasta I got was delicious."
    - (4 stars, 2025-06-14): "For a no fuss, good quality, pasta dish, this place is an excellent choice. Service was very friendly and efficient. At ‚Ç¨9:50 for a pot of pasta bolognese it‚Äôs not a ‚Äòcheap eat‚Äô but if you‚Äôre after a quick, tasty meal it‚Äôs worth considering."
    - (5 stars, 2024-02-24): "Do you want to taste real Italian pasta? Well that's the place! BEPE BIGOI is a high quality pasta fast-food where the product is produced right in the restaurant - from scratch. The chef actually prepares the pasta in front of the clients, protected by Glass; that way you can enjoy the whole process (craving for a delicious plate of pasta in the meanwhile). The restaurant is environmentally friendly, and they use compostable materials to pack the products. The staff is lovely, and highly trained; for them, the customer service is a priority. They also offer 20% DISCOUNT for University students, which allows them to eat delicious pasta even if you are on a budget. You can dine in or take it away - you decide. I suggest you try "Cacio e Pepe" and "sea fruits". You should accompany the pasta with a "Menabrea" beer. A special "thanks" to Francesco, whose customer service was impeccable! üëç"
    - (5 stars, 2018-01-06): "Finally a good Italian cuisine takeaway !!! They make the bigoli pasta in front of you. You pick the sauce t√® voila! In few min you have a gorgeous meal in your hands. To make the pasta they use semola. The prices are average (between 5-7‚Ç¨ for portion) and the portions quite generous. They use degradable boxes for your pasta. No toilets or seats available."
    - (4 stars, 2019-05-30): "Excellent pasta and great prices. Got all three pastas for $17.00. Would go there again for sure. Great place if you don't want to pay a service charge per person. No seating at restaurant but plenty of places around to sit and eat."

    - (3 stars, 2025-06-20): "nice position, nice staff but generally overrated and overpriced. portion of lasagna is super lame and small, three sheets, with too much and too baked cheese, with just a little meat on top. gnocchi were very salty and the portion was too big/heavy. overall we were not nearly as satisfied as in some other restaurants in Italy"

    - (5 stars, 2025-06-03): "A lovely dinner on the outside patio at Al Prato, looking across Prato della Valle at the sunset glow on Abbazia di Santa Giustina.     - (3 stars, 2025-05-09): "The bread and gnocchi were home made and delicious but we were specially told the breaded chicken milanese was homemade and it was clearly an orange pre packaged bought and fried processed dish. Very disappointed!"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-16): "This review is for the restaurant. In my five days in Padova I ate three times at Al Santo. It would have been four but they're closed on Tuesdays. Twice I had the pasta and fagioli soup. It was wonderful. I also.had the house-made macaroni with baccala and artichokes. Very good.. Dessert each time,.twice with the cake of the day. The restaurant has a clean,.modern feel..The staff are very friendly. The food is great and it seems that lots of locals eat.there. Al.Santo is just steps from the basilica."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-21): "What an excellent restaurant find near Saint Antonio Cathedral. Great food, Great Service, Great Atmosphere."
    - (5 stars, 2024-08-16): "A really nice atmosphere, very clean and pretty place. Food was also delicious and the staff was especially nice :) 10 stars to the waiter from Sarajevo, he was nice and also told us where to visit since it was our first time in Padova. Felt like home :)"
    - (5 stars, 2024-08-19): "We (two adults, two children 5&2 years) came here to eat one Sunday evening after mass and a visit at St Antonio tomb and reliquary. We did not stay in the hotel but ate at the restaurant. So my review for Room, Service and Locationnis rated accordingly. Room is in reference to the atmosphere and ambiance inside the restaurant which was beautiful, nice art, great lighting and decor, good layout, and nice music - not loud that you can‚Äôt speak over dinner. Everything was very clean and tidy. They pay attention to details, and tables were laid out simply with clean lines, colourful glasses and appropriately considering the cuisine. Floors were clean, seats were clean with no crumbs and table was clean and not sticky like other places. I had to use the baby changing facility which was extremely clean, tidy and had a baby changing table. WC didn‚Äôt stink at all! My only request would be for paper towels in the bathroom, and a step stool for a small child to use the sink. Service was excellent, friendly staff speaking English and Italian and very kind and helpful. Our table was tended to frequently (booth) and they always asked if we needed any food or drink which always arrived promptly. They were willing to answer our cuisine questions and offered us complementary bread. The children were very hungry so this was a real bonus while we waited for our order. Our food did arrive very quickly. The pizzas were huge and very tasty, and my beef with spinach, Parmesan and cherry tomatoes was excellent! The house white was fresh and sparkly- and deserts were delicious, not overly decadent or too rich in consistency. We had the equivalent to cream br√ªl√©e and a cheesecake (modern light style) not overly flavoured or pretentious- also excellent! ALL the staff were friendly and patient with my 2 year old who just wanted to be on the floor and was at the end of her day. This honestly made such a difference because it‚Äôs always hard to manage restaurant visits with little ones but not here!! So thank you for the staffs attitude towards little children. We walked in off the street, into this restaurant, seeing that it looked nice inside. It was already getting dark outside so we were invited by the nice looking lighting and warm ambiance. We had our very large double sport Thule with us (wheelchair size) the helped us get in, place our Thule somewhere safe inside and showed us to our seat without any problem! The location as a 1 -2min walk from the bascillica and maybe an answer to prayer as we looked for a decent quite FLY FREE place near by. The prices were excellent considering portion sizes and taste was superb! Serious - I would recommend this to everyone! If we were staying another night we would come back again! Sadly I didn‚Äôt take any photos but the photos on their page do not do it justice!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-30): "Great restaurant with really good food! üòÄ"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-30): "We were visiting Padova for 3 days, we were searching for a good Chinese, as we always do when on holiday. The Shanghai Naturalmente had very good reviews, so we tried it and wow! The quality of the food was excellent! We live in a small town in Italy and my husband is vegan and although supermarkets cater for vegans, Italian restaurants are particular poor at offering vegan options. The Shanghai was way beyond our expectation. We ate here for the 3 days we were here. Food is freshly prepared and cooked and there were many vegan and vegetarian options. The staff were friendly, super efficient and it was reasonably priced. We had rice, rice noodles, veg dim sum, and I had very fresh ginger and garlic prawns on iron plate. We would come back to Padova just to eat here! We hope to return in September. Complementi! Highly recommended!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-02): "Shanghai Restaurant in Padua is an absolute gem ‚Ä¶!! Stepping into this place felt superb, greeted by friendly, happy staff and it‚Äôs no wonder‚Äîbeing the first Chinese restaurant in the city; the food was absolutely amazing. It has an unique feature: a glass floor with a koi pond beneath, enjoying our meal while watching colorful fish swim below. Ôøº The atmosphere is cozy yet lively, making it the perfect spot for an adventurous night out or day for that matter. For anyone craving a taste of China in Padua, Shanghai Restaurant is a must-visit."
    - (5 stars, 2025-03-19): "The service is really nice and the people working in the restaurant are always very friendly and smiling! I have visited the restaurant many times and the food is always exceptionally good. When we asked to remove the egg and the meat from a specific dish, our claim was probably overseen (it was Saturday and the restaurant was full). However, they immediately took the plate back, without us asking for that and they replaced it. Thank you so much for the great experience every time I visit you."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-27): "I went to this place a few times and it's great. Staff is very polite. Food is incredible and exceeded all of my expectations. It's a very good place and I recommend"
    - (5 stars, 2024-04-14): "One of the best authentic Chinese food we ever had. A very good variety on the menu both vegetables and non vegetarian food. We enjoyed so much that decided to visit again during our short holiday break."

It has an average rating of 4.1 over 5 based on 1972 costumers.

Opening hours:
 open daily from 10:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 AM.

Website: http://gourmetteria.com/
Phone: 049 659830

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-18): "Walked past it a few times whilst sightseeing in Padova. It looks more like a shop than a restaurant but it is both. Great meal with some exceptional and different Italian food. The waitress was lovely and kind. It was quiet when we got in (about 7.30pm) but got busier a little later. It is a bit more expensive but worth it."
    - (3 stars, 2024-07-30): "If, but only if you want to eat secondi in size of antipasti but priced as expensive secondi that's the place for you. Additionally, you will be seated among shop's shelves and empty boxes. The food itself is overdone. Nothing special. The ladies toilet was broken and the dirty men toilet was the only one. Three waitresses kept talking behind the bar instead of taking care of the only toilet. We were looked down upon by the waitress when we asked about the wine. Well, never forget the Italian waitresses know everything about the wine. Avoid!"
    - (3 stars, 2024-10-07): "I am very conflicted about this place, we came without reservation, they sat us at the bar and made to feel unwelcome, they forgot to bring us several times the water we asked for and mostly ignored us. The burger was excellent tho. But the dessert felt like kids level."
    - (2 stars, 2023-08-22): "I went to have dinner and was disastrous. Firstly, when the tall waitress tells in 20 mins, the kitchen closes, so he almost kicks you out in the door. I understand but then set the kitchen 2 hours BEFORE closing. Once inside, zero help to order. Food came, and honestly,....very normal. Wine was served warm, a 53‚Ç¨ Barolo bottle (had to ask to be chilled), but at least the sommelier she was smiling. Final killer, the bill. They are charging 5 euros to sit. Holy cow!! Indeed, and of course, nothing to the waitresses. Never ever again, attitude and spirit is just wrong. Food again is very average. Don't waste your money here. There are many better!"
    - (5 stars, 2019-06-16): "I personally like very much this modern restaurant in the center of Padova. I think their food is first quality, they offer traditional Veneto' s meal but re invented under a modern view. They also offer burgers and pizza, and they have different options for vegetarians. I think that their best meal is the duck. I also like the fact that you can see the kitchen. Very good wine selection. You can also buy different food products from all Italy. Staff professional and friendly It is an informal restaurant, it s not overprized. I came here with my family almost every Saturday for lunch. High recommanded"

Just a tourist robbery. If you want to be taken advantage of then this is your spot! Best of luck to the management until you have to sell :)"
    - (5 stars, 2024-10-04): "No idea why people write bad reviews about this cafe. You‚Äôre in Italy, it‚Äôs normal that not everyone is speaking English. The lady who took our order was very friendly even though we communicated without speaking Italian. Desserts are first class, cute little cafe to have a break and drink a coffee."
    - (1 stars, 2025-06-13): "‚Ç¨18 for 2 portions of Millefoglie and one cola! Each Millefoglie is 7‚Ç¨ and it's a dry and nauseating gastronomic experience. The staff do not speak or understand English. Fooled me just this once!"

Bar Ristorante Pizzeria Otivm Lunch Cafe' is a restaurant located at Via Roma, 69, 35122.

 open daily from 9:00 AM ‚Äì 2:00 AM.

Website: https://mymenuweb.com/it/restaurants/1045027/?utm_source=google_profile&utm_medium=google_profile&utm_campaign=admin
Phone: 049 658328

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2025-05-08): "Lovely small restaurant with a big menu set across from the church, on a busy Main Street. ‚≠êÔ∏è friendly and welcoming staff albeit slow service. üçù pasta was good üå± vegetarian options available üç∏ good selection of cocktails and wine available. üç∫ good selection of beer. üê∂ dog friendly (no water bowl provided) ü™ë outdoor covered seating"
    - (4 stars, 2025-06-14): "Nice, tourist-friendly restaurant with extensive menu. Staff were very friendly and very, very busy!! Only negative issue was the 40+ minute wait for a couple of paninis to be served following order. When served, they were fresh, warm and very tasty. Extensive seating outside and inside (with much needed air conditioning when 30‚ÄôC outside)."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-27): "the pizza was perfect, the indigrients ae fresh and the service is friendly"
    - (5 stars, 2023-08-05): "Great service. The waiters would give up their whole life just so you could order. For comparison in my country (Slovakia) let's say you are not sure what you would get in a restaurant and you ask them a question regarding the menu thats written on a sign in front of the restaurant. The response from the waiter would be something along the lines of "I don't have time for this, we have it written on the sign *pointing at the sign*" while here in Italy and especially in this restaurant they literally brought the sign to me so I could see the menu better. And it's not just that. They are very polite, understand English very well and also have menu's in like 5 languages. German, British, Espanol, and some others I don't quite recall. The food was amazing! Great price for what you get. I would even say that it's one of the cheaper ones. But don't let that fool you. The food is truly mouth-watering. We've been here two times, and both of the times, it was a pleasure experience. The staff even asked us if we were enjoying our trip and told us to enjoy Italy. Also, I forgot to mention that here you don't pay the standard price for the table, silverware, and glasses. I don't recall how it is called in Italian, but I think it was something along the lines of "crosceto"."
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-27): "We ABSOLUTELY Love this place! So appreciate the Service ... Kind & Fast! Always feel Welcome! I really don't want to tell you about this place because you may take our outside seat! LOL! Grazie Mille to all of you who work here ... Thanks so Much!"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-27): "Highlights: I really enjoyed the liver with polenta. This was one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in Italy in a while. Overall this place had the potential for a 5 star, but there were a few things that could have been better: - service: it felt like we needed to call the waiters multiple times - service: strangely we were told there is no balsamic vinegar - fish: the fish tasted a bit funny - did not get the impression that it was fresh."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-09): "We loved this place. The owner was very accommodating as we had a baby in a large stroller and couldn't fit into the space initially reserved for us (I didn't make it clear on the phone that we were with a baby) so she offered us to wait 20 min until another table with enough space was available. We returned in 20 min and had a lovely meal. The food is delicious and wholesome. Local flavours at a very reasonable price. Very cosy, warm atmosphere. Friendly service. Thank you for the experience."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-02): "Authentic little osteria down a side alley. Food was fresh and well prepared. Very busy with quick table turnover. Walk in possible but reservation would be wise. Spent 69 euros for two appetizers, one pasta, and a main, 3 glasses of house wine and water. Very reasonably priced for quality. Lasagna with asparagus and guanicale main were both amazing. What a way to end last night of two weeks in Italy!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-07-02): "Delicious combinations i've never tried before. Cozy domestic atmosphere and very friendly and kind staff. I am very satisfied."
    - (5 stars, 2025-07-03): "True italian osteria - if you want to find real local ambiente, go there! Fantastic local food, wine, very nice staff. For tourists, for local peopke, for everybody!"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-04): "We try to visit Isola di Caprera when in Padova. Last time we had lunch. We were assisted by Matteo, very experienced person, who runs the dining area smoothly. I recommend Bigoli al ragu d'anatra, Filetto al pepe verde (exploding in your mouth and precisely prepared), seppie ala veneziana. The Baccala was geared for those who love it - we found that we're not crazy about it. A great compensation were both Riesling and Lugana Otella. Good value for your money. Recommend."
    - (4 stars, 2025-06-16): "Very nice Italian fare. Charming location, excellent service."
    - (5 stars, 2023-06-13): "About one of the best meals I have had in Italy. If you like seafood this is the place. If you are new to seafood you are in for a treat. And don‚Äôt worry if all the outdoor tables are busy, Mateo will deftly lift one from the dining hall (glasses and all) and set you up outside. The staff are super nice, especially Mateo who helped us with our food and wine selections. I can recommend the seafood platter (boiled fish) and the seafood risotto and the spaghetti with sardines, which is not salty at all. In fact, it‚Äôs surprisingly light and has lovely subtle flavors. Oh yum yum yum."
    - (2 stars, 2022-01-08): "Average restaurant in an advantageous location. Unfortunately the quality of the food is quite and surprisingly bad, not aligned with the place. The service was good and friendly. The price is medium but compared to what you eat.. it should be even cheaper."
    - (4 stars, 2021-12-06): "A small touch of vintage style for this restaurant. Food to choose from fish to meat. I tried the spaghetti alle vongole which was good but too oily for my taste. The Grissini and bread are super good, best of the whole meal üíï. Also the waiters and waitresses are super good."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2023-09-17): "Wow! What a pleasant surprise stumbling upon this little snack and wine bar. Fresh array of cicchetti and a lovely selection of wines. Fun and friendly bartenders. Vibes were off the charts. You must go!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-10): "A super cute enoteca in the heart of Padova. Prices are reasonable, and it's a great student-friendly spot for warm chitchats after a long day‚Äîeven with the owner himself!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-11): "Super cozy and great selection of wine"

But only during the season, there are just a few seats inside and if you came after 9 pm you'll definitely have to stand whole evening (on such a quiant little street)"

Website: https://www.enotavola.com/home
Phone: 049 876 2385

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-20): "An intriguing seafood-centric restaurant in Padua with a well-curated wine selection. The flavors struck a nice balance‚Äîcreative yet comfortably familiar. There are contemporary variations of conventional foods such as mayonnaise made out of pythoplankton. Every dish was fresh and made to order, showcasing a clear attention to quality. I particularly enjoyed the red shrimps (presumably harvested from the Adriatic) and the scampi, both served unshelled and as part of a mixed seafood platter. Interestingly, the breads didn‚Äôt seem freshly baked, which stood out slightly against the otherwise high standards. The wine house spirit is evident in the details too‚Äîlike the walls, thoughtfully lined with wine corks, adding character and charm to the space. While the restaurant is recommended in the Michelin Guide, it hasn‚Äôt been awarded a star. Prices are not cheap and on par with starred restaurants. Still, I‚Äôd happily return. Finally, make sure you have a reservation due to its popularity."
    - (4 stars, 2025-04-12): "Stumble upon this restaurant while making a pitstop in Padua. The restaurant has been awarded or rather feature in Michelin guide for many years. The wait staff is kind. The food is also great. 1. Crudo seafood of the day. The seafood is fresh and super sweet. Drizzled those with extra virgin olive oil and a pitch of sale, very simple but showcasing how good the seafood is very well. 2. Mixed battered seafood, again great seafood, very crispy. What surprise me is they also serve fish, I don‚Äôt see that often. This comes with horseradish mayo which is perfect. Though, I‚Äôd love to see a lemon wedge (to add a bit more acid). 3. Mussel and rosemary, very simple and straightforward. 4. Tiramisu, very good. It‚Äôs almost like a soft browny with a hint of coffee than tiramisu 5. Mango something, i dont remember exact but there‚Äôs mango, coconut. Overall, very refreshing and great to end the meal. Overall, great experience and would love to come back again to try other dishes."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-22): "This is my favorite restaurant in Padua. You have to order the spaghetti if you go, but everything on the menu is wonderful. The people who work here are so kind and knowledgeable and go out of your way to make the experience memorable."
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-18): "Seafood dishes we ordered were perfectly delicious, including desserts. Highly recommend."
    - (5 stars, 2025-07-02): "Amazing restaurant with exceptional food and excellent value. The tasting menu was full of surprises - innovative and delicious. The desert is better than many Michelin starred restaurants! Would definitely return to try many other tempting dishes we did not have room for. Michelin stars will not be far off I hope."

Phone: 375 619 7434

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-07-02): "Excellent innovative food by a passionate chef. The flavours, drawing from the chef's travels, are well judged. I enjoyed the bao with ceviche a lot. Lots of surprises in the menu - the apple dessert was delightful in taste and presentation."
    - (5 stars, 2023-04-30): "One of the most memorable meals I've had - Chef Stefano made equally delicious and beautiful bites as part of the Venetian 9-course tasting menu. He and his staff were so gracious and welcoming, and we loved to hear the description of each plate as it was presented to us. The food was outstanding and creative. Highly recommend!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-07-16): "The only thing more impressive than the quality of the food is Stefano‚Äôs personality and the incredible service staff. The ‚Äúgrilled‚Äù pasta is a dish that I will never forget. Similarly with the BBQ oysters. So different and so delicious. A jewel of a restaurant."
    - (5 stars, 2022-06-10): "The tasting menu at this restaurant is a truly unique experience - rewarding, and at times challenging. In the best way!! Chef Stefano is pushing boundaries and experimenting in the true spirit of innovation. We did the ‚Äúextremis‚Äù tasting menu (8 courses plus extras)‚Ä¶. Highlights (look for these on the regular menu as well if you opt not to do tasting): ‚ÄúBBQ‚Äù risotto - imagine a risotto infused with smokiness of the grill, finished with a bright lemon zest. If you‚Äôre having trouble I don‚Äôt blame you, it‚Äôs pretty unique. But you must taste it! Grilled branzino with vegetables - PERFECTLY cooked and seasoned. One of the best bites ever. Beef tartare with asparagus and eggs - the quality of meat in Italy is just stellar and makes dishes like this superb. For those who want challenges: tomato sorbetto - when you eat this you may get confused. Actually it might‚Äôve have been a special creation for the ‚Äúextremis‚Äù course. It‚Äôs like gazpacho ice cream. The texture is amazingly smooth, you can cut thin slices with a spoon and it holds its form. BBQ pomodoro - the BBQ is a bit forward in this dish compared to the risotto, the addition of sun dried tomatoes is a nice garnish. We felt oddly compelled to keep eating it though :) All in all, chef stefano and all the team at this restaurant deserve your support! You‚Äôre not going to find traditional classics here but if you are in the mood for pushing the boundaries give it a try."
    - (5 stars, 2022-03-24): "We enjoyed our gastronomic experience of contemporary interpretation of traditional venetian cuisine last night by Chef Stefano Mocellin at Padovanino. You have the option of 2 types of d√©gustation menu as well as alla carte, and he uses a bit of Japanese techniques in his cooking. üòç #HighlyRecommended"

    - (5 stars, 2025-05-10): "Best meal I had in a week in Italy, everything was exceptional, including the staff! Highly recommend it"
    - (4 stars, 2025-05-02): "Very polite and welcoming staff. Fish is the main product here. A little overpriced."
    - (5 stars, 2023-11-18): "I rarely review but the service was 10 stars! Such fast and warm professionalism, they genuinely enjoy hosting their patrons and give such good recommendations.     - (5 stars, 2025-03-08): "Innovative and fine cuisine. Italian classics with a twist, I would say. I had Tataki di Cuore, which was delicious and made really good.     - (4 stars, 2024-07-22): "Sat out in the piazza for dinner. Waiter seemed a bit uninterested in us. Food was great however the corn ribs were amazing! It was lovely sitting outside and watching the piazza."
    - (5 stars, 2023-03-11): "Quite a nice place. We enjoyed the food here-- everything was tasty and the pink salad was special! The only disappointing aspect was that they didn't have wine by the glass from Italy. They only had it by the glass from France which is a true pity because that's one of the great reasons to be in Italy--try some Italian wine!"
    - (5 stars, 2022-12-23): "Wine list is one of the best in the world if you like natural wine, for example they have over 20 labels from domaine l‚Äôoctavin alone. Food is modern and interesting, some very surprising recipes"
    - (1 stars, 2025-04-24): "The pasta was still hard!! And that in Italy üò°üò°. I wouldn't recommend it! The sauce had no flavor and the staff were a disrespectful disaster. ü§Æ The bread was by far the best, and it was free. A complete waste of time and not recommended!"

    - (5 stars, 2023-07-17): "Lovely little spot hidden away from the busy streets. The staff was very friendly and accommodating as I don‚Äôt speak a lock of Italian. Had a sandwich that was delicious and two refreshing glasses of white wine. Able to pay with credit card. Recommend for a nice lunch away from the busier streets."
    - (4 stars, 2022-09-03): "If you are not Italian, please keep in mind the kitchen closes after lunch and they only serve drinks. We got there at 15:00 and there was no food being served anymore. The only strange thing is that when you are in the toilet, you can see a camera placed outside but there is glass so it really feels uncomfortable.     - (3 stars, 2018-06-30): "6.29.18 - stopped here for a drink while waiting for dinner to open. The staff us super nice and they let us sit inside in the back with the A/C with our family.     - (5 stars, 2021-10-09): "My favorite place to sit down for lunch in Padua, especially outside in the beautiful piazzata! I‚Äôve ordered a few different items, from salad to pasta, and I am always impressed and satisfied. The staff is also so kind and patient, as I‚Äôm an American living in Padua, trying to learn Italian! I would absolutely recommend this place."
    - (5 stars, 2023-06-10): "My Aperitivo place no.1 in Padua with a fine selection of (local) wines, typical drinks - did someone say Aperol Spritz? - and snacks, off the beaten tracks and crowds. The staff makes you feel really welcome even with little to no Italian vocabulary. Well, and the scenery of this hidden alley speaks for itself. Grazie mille!!"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-15): "There are so many culinary options at Palazzo Della Regione. Adriatica has everything for your seafood lunch or dinner if you want to eat-in or take-out home. Enjoy a crisp white Lugana glass of wine while you have warm Paella or better yet an insalata di mare. The seafood is very fresh and the quality is apparent. Pricing is low and for a couple the bill was 56 euro, we were too full to finish our plates, and the bill includes 4 glasses of wine. That is a reasonably priced dinner."
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-12): "Today we ate lunch at the Adriatica Pescheria. It was wonderful. The service was perfect. I ordered pasta with mussels in a spicy sauce off menu. It was the best I have ever eaten. The prices were reasonable for such fresh seafood. We are going back next Thursday."
    - (2 stars, 2025-05-11): "Well , overrated and not so good, 7,5 euro for a small portion of octopus üêô salad hard as a ü™® rock it‚Äôs a no! Wine also expensive"
    - (5 stars, 2024-10-27): "Fresh delicious seafood! We were satisfied. Good service. Will come again."
    - (5 stars, 2024-06-25): "Great food and not that expensive for serving fish food"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-27): "Delicious food, attentive service, decent (but not too extensive) wine list. The interior is stylish, but not over pretentious, making it an ideal place for a quiet dinner. I have been there on a couple of occasions, tried both fish and meat dishes and never left disappointed. Michelin star well deserved."
    - (5 stars, 2024-10-14): "A real find in Padua! Creative cooking beautifully presented-- excellent service, thoughtful wine list and lovely dining room made for a wonderful evening! We will be back for sure."
    - (5 stars, 2023-06-06): "Let's start from the end: totally worth it! The place is very cute and service is really well looked after. We had 3 courses and everything was good and peculiar. The Locara, if you like the idea, is great. Also, fairly inexpensive: we had two starters, two main, one shared dessert, two glasses of prosecco, one glass of red and one of white and water and we barely spent 60‚Ç¨ each. Will definitely go back if I happen to be in Padova again"
    - (1 stars, 2025-04-16): "I made a reservation a couple of months ago. When we came to the restaurant, people who worked there were inside and saw us but the door was locked. We waited for 15 minutes. No one opened the door. We finally left. How unprofessional. We were excited to try this restaurant on the start of our time in Italy. I have never experienced this before at any restaurant and we have travelled abroad extensively. Quite honestly, I don‚Äôt know how they got a Michelin rating."
    - (5 stars, 2023-12-29): "By far the best meal we had in Italy. We wanted to escape the hellscape of restaurants in Venice. We found ourselves in this haven in nearby Padua. The waiter was kind and spared me from speaking my bad Italian. I know no one goes to a place for its breadsticks, but, damn, those were good. My squid and polenta was great. Other dishes sang. My only quibble was the tiramisu. It was made with cookies that weren't soaked in coffee/booze. That's ok. It was interesting. Please, patronize this wonderful operation and its people. They do a great job and deserve our attention. What greater gift can we give than our time and attention?"

Reviews:
    - (4 stars, 2025-06-19): "Been coming here at least every 2 weeks to watch a match with friends and every time we are greeted with fast service , good food for low price (I personally recommend the pasata messicana, partly because I‚Äôm Mexican, partly because it‚Äôs really good) and really friendly my staff who speaks m√∫ltiple languages. For big groups I do recommend calling earlier or showing up 1 hour earlier before an event in case you want indoor seating, the outside seating is so nice so it‚Äôs really up to your preferences. I do recomend skipping the bathroom, it‚Äôs honestly a warzone all the time."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-10): "We had great service by Shqipron, very fast, very nice and in all Padova we didn't have better service. I recommend this place. Good pizza, good beer, good spritz what do you want more... Maybe good price... You have it also here üòä."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-08): "Flybar will always have a special place in my heart. I spent so many evenings (maybe too many?) here during my Erasmus ‚Äî and honestly, I wouldn't have had it any other way. The atmosphere is laid-back, the music is always on point, and the crowd is a great mix of locals and internationals. But let‚Äôs get to the real highlight: the cheap Aperol Spritz. I don‚Äôt know how they do it, but somehow it's always the perfect mix ‚Äî refreshing, slightly bitter, and dangerously affordable. It basically became my signature drink while I was in town. Whether it was starting the night with friends or just dropping in for a spontaneous Spritz (or three), Flybar was our Erasmus living room. If you're looking for good vibes, friendly faces, and the best value Aperol in town, this is the place. I‚Äôll definitely be back when I return ‚Äî because some places just stick with you."
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-22): "This place is amazing. The guy also made drinks free from alcohol. So if you‚Äôre a person who doesn‚Äôt like to drink the this is the best place for you."
    - (5 stars, 2024-11-18): "For me personally its my favorite bar in the world. The design of the bar itself might not be the prettiest but as a german i cant recommend this place more for its price quality value. Not only the drinks are cheap and good but also the food is amazing as seen in the pictures (one of the best burgers and pizzas ive ever tried in my life). But more importantly, their staff is what makes fly shine. The waiters and barmen care about every single guest that enters that bar and always try to make you smile. Simply the best ‚ù§Ô∏èüëå"

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-06): "Went here for a leisurely Sunday lunch and it was excellent. Local ingredients, beautifully prepared, presented elegantly but without fuss. Super choice of wines. Lovely service and a simple but refined atmosphere. Value for money was excellent. Highly recommend."
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-04): "Everything about VinET is top notch! Our only regret is that we did not go until our last night in Padova. We started with asparagus ravioli with grana padano custard and lemon crumble, and tagliolini with bottarga, tropea onions and cherry tomatoes. The best pasta dishes of the trip so far. For our secondi, we had roast veal fillet with thyme sauce, corn timbale and grilled onion, and wild boar from the Euganean Hills cooked at low temperature with spices, aromatic herbs and cranberry compote. We paired these with several different wines by the glass that the staff did a good job recommending."
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-21): "I liked it here a lot! The food and wine were probably the best I have had in our whole visit to Italy - Tuscany. The meal I had was so well balanced and at the same time original. Although we are not Italians, both waitresses were hospitable and kind (which is not always the case). Thank you!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-04-11): "Great food, beautiful restaurant and atmosphere, and reasonable prices. Really recommend!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-05-26): "I went there on a late Sunday night without a booking and Domingo kindly welcomed this hungry tourist and seated me in a minute. Then, Hajar greeted me with the prettiest smile and patiently answered my questions. The food was really nice. I had the chicken salad, the roasted octopus and the strawberry and mascarpone crumble."

Reviews:
    - (1 stars, 2025-04-18): "DO NOT GO! TOURIST TRAP. If you are not a Padovani, they give you crappy drinks. I got charged 7E for a "mojito" that was a cheap limone soft drink with some spritz. The Padovani get proper drinks in wine glasses. Everyone else gets crappy drinks in drinking glasses"
    - (5 stars, 2023-05-27): "Best Pizza alla Pala in Town, crispy tomato organic e all ingredient Farm to Table. Coffe is local and the outdoor patio Is magic with the view of the entire Square. Love the action of the market in the am while drinking coffe in the caf√® Serafina patio."

Reviews:
    - (5 stars, 2023-09-16): "Quite a surprise to find such a cool craft beer bar while walking through the beautiful streets of Padova. Young guy running the place knows his stuff. And has an impressive collection of beer and brewery memorabilia on the walls. Seems to especially appreciate Sierra Nevada. A range of styles on draft, from German lagers to American hoppy beers, to local Italian versions of common styles. All delicious and enjoyed in a unique place. For food there is the ubiquitous selection of cicchetti. Bravo!"
    - (5 stars, 2025-06-09): "Great bar with good people, had some enjoyable times here in the old Jewish Ghetto quarter."
    - (5 stars, 2025-01-22): "We loved the pub crawl experience in Padova, and this was one of our favourite bars! They serve a wide variety of international beers, often changing out what's in their barrels. Besides they serve wine but no Hugo's. The tables are old sewing machines, which we thought super cool üòé"
    - (5 stars, 2025-02-14): "A pub/bar with excellent vibes. The way the locals interacted with the bartenders was a huge green flag. Had a couple of beers including a recommendation and all were lovely. Awesome place!"
    - (5 stars, 2024-01-30): "It became one of my favorite places in Padova after first visit. :) There are some Italian draft craft beers, super cool music and really nice host Martino (on the photo :))."
